definition[0]: to move back suddenly and quickly from something you do not like or are afraid of
example[0]: She recoiled from his touch as if she had been slapped.
definition[1]: to feel such a strong dislike of a particular situation that you want to avoid it
example[1]: We recoil in horror from the thought of subjecting someone to extreme pain.
example[2]: He recoils from everything in life that demands hard work.
definition[2]: if a gun recoils, it moves backwards very quickly after it has been fired
